intro: Berkheya radyeri, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble daisies. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and grows in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and rocky areas. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance. Berkheya radyeri is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and dry conditions.
